Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

  1. The cost for an upcoming field trip is $15 per student. The cost of the field trip C, in dollars, is a function of the number of students x. Select two possible outputs for the function defined by \(C(x)=15x\).

Correct! 30, 90

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 4.12.1-4.12.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answers are 30, 90.

  1. A rectangle has an area of  \(24   cm^2\). Function \(f\) gives the length of the rectangle, in centimeters when the width is \(w\) cm.
    Determine which values, in centimeters, are possible inputs of the function. Select three that apply.

Correct!  Possible: 3, 0.5, 48. Not possible: -6, 0.

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 4.12.1-4.12.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answers are: Possible: 3, 0.5, 48. Not possible: -6, 0.

  1. Select three possible input-output pairs for the function \(y=x^3\).

Correct!  \((-1,-1)\), \(\left(\frac12,\frac18\right)\), \((4,64)\)

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.12.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answers are: \((1,-1)\), \(\left(\frac12,\frac18\right)\), \((4,64)\).

  1. Two functions are defined by the equations \(f(x)=5−0.2x\) and \(g(x)=0.2(x+5)\).
     
    Select twopossible statements that are true about the functions.

Correct! 

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.12.3? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answers are \(f(3)>0\), \(g(-1)=0.8\).

  1. Is the relation graphed below a function?

Correct! No, this is not a function because 4 maps to both -1 and −3.

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.12.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is; No, this is not a function because 4 maps to both -1 and −3.

  1. Is the relation graphed below a function?

Correct! no; This is not a function because −3 maps to both 4 and −4.

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.12.3 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is no; This is not a function because −3 maps to both 4 and −4.

Use the following scenario for questions 7 - 9.

For a fundraiser, Chi and her class are having a talent show and charging $7 a ticket. There are 100 seats in the theater. The function \(T\), gives the total for selling \(n\) tickets and is represented by \(T(n)=7n\).

  1. Enter the minimum domain value.

Correct! The minimum domain value is 0

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.12.5. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is that the minimum domain value is 0.

  1. Enter the maximum domain value.

Correct! The maximum domain value is 100.

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.12.5. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is that the maximum domain value is 100.

  1. Is 30 a possible output in the range?

Correct! No; 30 is not a possible value in the range because all values of the range must be multiples of 7.

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.12.5 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 30 is not a possible value in the range because all values of the range must be multiples of 7.
